Still, why does Tahm have to be nerfed if "all tanks will be useless in season 6 anyway"? Doesnt make any sense..

Because you're operating off of a logical fallacy based on their hyperbole. Not every tank will actually be useless come season 6 (except according to Doomsayers and upvote farmers, but Doomsayers have been around for millennia and look at their accuracy thus far). So, now that we dispelled the hyperbole, we come to the specifics of Tahm Kench. Now we can isolate his case and tackle it by itself now that we aren't lumping him in with everyone else due to the Boards circlejerk. Now we can properly discuss why he needs nerfed - which he does.

This isnt a hyperbole. Everyone ever literally said that all tanks will be weak due to item, meta and direct champion changes. Even if they are "upvote farmers", people still have to upvote, which means they agree. And Tahm doesnt need to get nerfed at all, especially not when there are such big changes coming.

the whole basis of upvote farmers is that they say something that is generally agreed upon and matches up to 90% of people's expectations.  They exclude specifics like tahm ken when they do this.  the reason why tahm is considered needing a nerf is because his specific skill, denying damage to his allies, is deemed WAY to powerful and impactful on the game by the community right now if for no other reason than the uptime.  If his devour ability was an ult and used only once every two minutes no one would complain.  That it is a basic skill that basically denies not only the entire class of assassins, but even a large number of champions outside it like burst mages syndra, lux, annie, as well as dive heavy fighters like shyvana, vi and J4 from doing their job is what makes people say he is op.  To make matters worse he is so inherently tanky that when he does deny you, you can't do anything to stop him so you just kind waste your skills and possibly lose the teamfight.

You're getting so wrapped up in the general idea of tanks being nerfed you arent looking at the specifics of a champion when they are brought up.  What Riot has been doing is increasingly making every single champion in league completely unique with their own distinct strengths and weaknesses.  High level play of a single champion is less and less transferring over to the entire class or even sub-class.  This is most apparent in game changing skills that determine the strength of the champion and an individual's value in playing that champion.

He denies damage to an ally, but he also makes that ally unable to do any damage, which isnt too strong at all. If it has such a high cooldown it would be really weak. I wouldnt complain if Rivens E was her ult on 1-2 minutes cooldown either, but that doesnt mean it would be fine like that. 
Tahm doesnt completely stop these champs from doing their job, he simply creates counterplay against them that they can play around as well. Its not OP that Tahm can counter pick comps that rely on hitting something like a Morg or Lux Q, its a good thing. If you want to play a pick comp, ban Tahm. If you play a poke team that kites Tahm or a heavy engage team that just rolls over him, you dont need to care. Gameplay like that is what League needs. See, you say "you just kind waste your skills and possibly lose the teamfight" because he is a tank. If you would be talking about any other tank, people would just reply "then dont waste your spells for the tank lel", or if you were talking about Yasuos windwall, people would say "then dont blow all your cooldowns into it kek", but since Tahm magically has a global taunt and is impossible to kite as well, thats not a thing?

And I dont think tanks will be bad in season 6, especially Rammus for example, who is way better than Tahm.

Im not disputing the strength of tanks.  surprisingly they may actually see some minor improvement, but I feel that fighters are going to be receiving the benefit from all the changes to armor more so than tanks.  I am saying that tahm's strategical value is to great.  with riot's recent change to make every champion unique they have, probably inadvertently, created two huge divides in how a champion can be OP.  

the most well known in individual asset. this is the champion just having too much raw power or something that prevents the enemy team from dealing with them properly.  Best example would be zed and lee sin who have had the issue of too much safety with all their damage. 

the newer OP state is strategical asset.  this is something that has appeared in LCS more often than not.  strategically OP champions, in the case of tahm kench, have such a huge value that not taking them is almost a mistake.  In the case of tahm kench you talked about his weaknesses.  that's not the problem.  the problem is that his invalidating burst so completely and forcibly making damage aim at him is the most tank thing that you can do in this game.  He forces his oppenents to get through him which generally is not possible because he is a tank.  the answer, just ban him, does not take away from the fact that if he does enter the picture he is worse to deal with than other cahmpions.  

In the case of yasuo and his windwall that counters siege, his siege countering is not so great that it is game breaking because sieges can go on for many minutes while the skill is down.  so even if it is OP it has decent counterplay.  the problem with tahm is that because he so heavily denies going in on any champion ANY all in is alway risky as when you do all in you generally aim for the squishiest member.  his stopping that from even being possible makes it OP.  if he had a simple delay on when he could take in his ally of like .5 seconds or something more and the skill needed to be PREDICTIVE, then tahm would be balanced.  as is it is reflexive so it is deemed OP.

Well I already knew Tahm was gonna be quite OP in lcs when he came out. but we are not in lcs. Im talking about soloq and in soloq he isnt too strong at all because you cant abuse his strategical strengths with 4 strangers. 
I havent really played League a lot in the past month, but back when I did play and Tahm was played quite a few times as well, he never was a problem. Like he would just get kited every single time. All the time. There wasnt even a point in trying to fight as Tahm, you just got slowed or stunned once or twice and melted instantly. The only thing he could do was stop an ally from getting caught but you can do that with {{item:3222}} , {{champion:25}} {{item:3140}} or... good positioning as well. Other than that he just lost to poke because he is a tank that cant initiate and he lost in direct teamfights because he is nearly useless in those. 
Thats how I remember Tahm, idk what magically made him op lol.

K, take three cups of water. Got them? Now make one of them filled a little higher than the others. Label this as Tahm. Now take an equal amount out of each cup. I guess now the Tahm cup will now be the same level as the rest.

I understand that, but when people are saying "all tanks will be utterly useless in this meta", then Im assuming that all three cups of water are "filled way lower" than all the other cups. Thats my point, even if Tahm is above the other "tank cups", he would still be below all others.

The last whisper change effectively buff tanks armor though (because it doesn't ignore their base armor anymore).  But it is pretty weird that adcs are the only ones getting compensated for the mastery changes.

Tanks can start the game with a keystone mastery that gives them a flat 4% damage reduciton, escalating to 8% in a teamfight/skirmish. Damage reduction is huge, Alistar and Braum are big supports (and maokai is a big toplaner) because their %damage reduction makes them very tanky. There is also a ton of health regen for tanks in the Resolve tree which really helps out laning.

And tanks are not necessarily weak right now. Juggernauts, Tahm Kench, Alistar, Shen, Nautilus and hell even Zac saw competitive play at worlds.

And of course, {{summoner:12}} is getting nerfed, which means top lane becomes a more drawn out sustain-lane. Which really helps meatwalls and tanks.

Early AD on ADCs were increased at the cost of AD later on in the game. I guess if tanks want to lose 20 or so base armor so they can gain 5 armor at level 1, we can give that to them... You know, I don't think that base armor which can't be reduced by the new LW is all too useful. It's only about 80-100, which is 40%-50% reduction that can only be reduced by a Cleaver, flat ArP, and abilities that reduce armor, so it wouldn't hurt to nuke their armor from 80-100 to about 50-60, right? Get them down to a lowly 30ish percent base, amirite?

For those who paid little attention to the patch notes, LW does 30% of BONUS armor and the upgraded versions give 40% compared to 35% of TOTAL armor, so the Rammus and Braums with 100 armor at max level have a free 50% reduction that ADC's can't ignore as long as they get one armor item like a Randuin's, which reduces crit damage by 10%, an overall DPS loss of 5% with crits being a flat 50% with the basic IE+AS/Crit item. More of a loss on the ones with more crit chance.

But, you know. It's cool. We can give tanks 5 more armor at level 1 and reduce their armor at level 18 by 10-20 like ADs had their base AD reduced to.
